section.title: Simulating Policy Profiles on Virtual Machines

procedure.title: To Simulate Policy Profiles on Virtual Machines

step.para: Navigate to InfrastructureVirtual Machines, select the virtual machines you need to evaluate.
From the Select a Policy Profile to add dropdown, click the policy you need to apply to the selected virtual machines.
The virtual machine thumbnail displays in the Policy Simulation area.

listitem.para: A check sign in the lower right quadrant of the virtual thumbnail shows that the virtual machine passes policy.
A minus sign in the lower right quadrant of the virtual thumbnail shows that the virtual machine fails policy.

step.para: Click on a virtual machine in the Policy Simulation area to see its details.
Expand a policy profile by clicking on it to see its member policies and the status of the conditions.

listitem.para: Check Show out of scope items to show all conditions, whether or not the virtual machine passes the scope part of the condition. Uncheck it to hide conditions where the scope part fails.
Next to Show policies, check Successful to show policies that are passed and check Failed to see the policies that have failed. The default is to show both.
Items in green text passed the condition.
Items in red text failed the condition.
Items in red italics failed the condition, but do not change the outcome of the scope.

formalpara.title: Result:
formalpara.para: If you evaluate multiple policy profiles, you can see both policy profiles and a tree expanding down to their conditions.
